title: Unable to build curl with quiche 0.24.4
body:
### I did this

I did 
```
    1  cd curl_quiche/
    2  autoreconf -fi
    3  ./configure LDFLAGS="-Wl,-rpath,$PWD/../quiche/target/release" --with-openssl=$PWD/../quiche/quiche/deps/boringssl/src --with-quiche=$PWD/../quiche/target/release
    4  make clean
    5  make
```
Got below issue
```
  CC       vquic/libcurl_la-curl_quiche.lo
vquic/curl_quiche.c: In function ‘cf_quiche_adjust_pollset’:
vquic/curl_quiche.c:1156:3: error: implicit declaration of function ‘Curl_pollset_check’ [-Werror=implicit-function-declaration]
 1156 |   Curl_pollset_check(data, ps, ctx->q.sockfd, &want_recv, &want_send);
      |   ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
vquic/curl_quiche.c:1169:14: error: implicit declaration of function ‘Curl_pollset_set’; did you mean ‘Curl_conn_meta_set’? [-Werror=implicit-function-declaration]
 1169 |     result = Curl_pollset_set(data, ps, ctx->q.sockfd, want_recv, want_send);
      |              ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
      |              Curl_conn_meta_set
cc1: some warnings being treated as errors
make[2]: *** [Makefile:3505: vquic/libcurl_la-curl_quiche.lo] Error 1
make[2]: Leaving directory '/root/curl_quiche/lib'
make[1]: *** [Makefile:1657: all] Error 2
make[1]: Leaving directory '/root/curl_quiche/lib'
make: *** [Makefile:619: all-recursive] Error 1
root@ubuntu:~/curl_quiche#
root@ubuntu:~/curl_quiche# git log
commit 4b61e44e3d2093864c1beba984e90627bd12e43d (HEAD -> master, origin/master, origin/HEAD)
Author: Daniel Stenberg <daniel@haxx.se>
Date:   Mon Aug 4 23:21:14 2025 +0200

    tool_operate: use the correct config pointer

    Triggered when doing 100+ parallel globbed upload transfers.

    Reported-by: letshack9707 on hackerone

    Closes #18200
```
```

root@ubuntu:~/curl_quiche# cd ../quiche/
root@ubuntu:~/quiche# git log
commit 70d6d3e233568e906e66179a56c93cf9b0616899 (HEAD, tag: 0.24.4)
Author: Alessandro Ghedini <alessandro@ghedini.me>
Date:   Tue Jun 17 15:52:36 2025 +0100

    quiche: release 0.24.4

commit d796e1b9e62f2f7cc9180611d234e2dffa1db524
Author: Apoorv Kothari <akothari@cloudflare.com>
Date:   Wed Apr 23 15:23:30 2025 -0700

    prevent an optimistic ack attack by skipping packets

    As per the RFC's recommends, this PR adds mechanisms to periodically
    skip packets on send in order to track a mis-behaving peer and prevent
    an Optimistic ACK attack.
```

### I expected the following

Expected it to work.

### curl/libcurl version

```
root@ubuntu:~/quiche# curl -V
curl 8.16.0-DEV (x86_64-pc-linux-gnu) libcurl/8.16.0-DEV quictls/3.1.4 zlib/1.2.11 brotli/1.1.0 zstd/1.4.8 libpsl/0.21.0 nghttp2/1.67.0-DEV ngtcp2/1.12.0 nghttp3/1.9.0 OpenLDAP/2.5.19
Release-Date: [unreleased]
Protocols: dict file ftp ftps gopher gophers http https imap imaps ipfs ipns ldap ldaps mqtt pop3 pop3s rtsp smb smbs smtp smtps telnet tftp ws wss
Features: alt-svc AsynchDNS brotli HSTS HTTP2 HTTP3 HTTPS-proxy IPv6 Largefile libz NTLM PSL SSL threadsafe TLS-SRP UnixSockets zstd
root@ubuntu:~/quiche#
```

### operating system

```

root@ubuntu:~/quiche# uname -a
Linux ubuntu 5.15.0-151-generic #161-Ubuntu SMP Tue Jul 22 14:25:40 UTC 2025 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
root@ubuntu:~/quiche#
```
